intro: Caloptilium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plants typically grow in coastal areas, thriving in salty and well-drained soils. Caloptilium species are often found in Mediterranean and temperate regions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
